diff_hunk:
@@ -8,12 +8,51 @@ exports_files(["LICENSE"])
 
 package(default_visibility = ["//tensorflow:__subpackages__"])
 
+load("//tensorflow:tensorflow.bzl", "tf_custom_kernel_library")
+load("//tensorflow:tensorflow.bzl", "tf_custom_op_library")
+load("//tensorflow:tensorflow.bzl", "tf_gen_op_libs")
+load("//tensorflow:tensorflow.bzl", "tf_gen_op_wrapper_py")
 load("//tensorflow:tensorflow.bzl", "cuda_py_tests")
 
+tf_custom_kernel_library(
+    name = "lstm_kernels",
+    srcs = [
+        "kernels/lstm_ops.cc"
+    ],
+    hdrs = [
+        "kernels/lstm_ops.h"
+    ],
+    gpu_srcs = [
+        "kernels/lstm_ops_gpu.cu.cc"
+    ],
+    deps = [
+        "//tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib",
+        "//third_party/eigen3",
+    ],
+)
+
+tf_custom_op_library(
+    name = "python/ops/_lstm_ops.so",
+    srcs = [
+        "ops/lstm_ops.cc",
body: I don't understand why you can't put `ops/lstm_ops.cc`, `kernels/lstm_ops.cc` and `kernels/lstm_ops.h` in the `srcs` here. Note that `hdrs` is needed only if you want your `cc_library` to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.
body_html: I don't understand why you can't put ops/lstm_ops.cc, kernels/lstm_ops.cc and kernels/lstm_ops.h in the srcs here. Note that hdrs is needed only if you want your cc_library to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.
body_text: I don't understand why you can't put ops/lstm_ops.cc, kernels/lstm_ops.cc and kernels/lstm_ops.h in the srcs here. Note that hdrs is needed only if you want your cc_library to export those headers to dependent libraries. Here, that is not the case.
